item.title: Checking for a type of a object
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:14, topic:539024”]if(ObjectArrays.contains(ObjectArrays.furnace, id)) {
You already have public access to the furnace collection, why not just call contains on it instead…?[/quote]
I really wasn’t going over the code, I made this as an example just for this question.

Read full topic

item.title: Checking for a type of a object
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“DAn0194, post:3, topic:539024”][quote author=Clawz fury link=topic=657862.msg4400582#msg4400582 date=1390526254]
what exactly are you trying to do
[/quote]
You know how your server has like 8 different object ids for ranges. Would it be worth to make a class like this and in the static {} add each id to the hashset or just do:

case range1: case range2: case range3: case range4: case range5: case range6: case range7: case range8:[/quote]

AtomicInt_:

using a collection to store ids is a bit overkill.

KISS (keep it simple stupid)

arham 4:

Or lets start loading object data so we can base it on the name of the object instead…

or lets stop being a pretentious piece of shit because there are many objects with the same name that have different purposes

ps: DAn0194 is pretty much already better than you

Read full topic

item.source: Checking for a type of a object

item.title: Checking for a type of a object
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

So i was just wondering If this class is worth it or if there is a better way to do it.

[code=java]package org.hyperion.rs2.model;

import java.util.HashSet;

public class ObjectArrays {

/**
 * Array for all furnace
 */
public static HashSet<Integer> furnace = new HashSet<Integer>();

/**
 * Checks if specific Hashset contains the integer
 */
public static boolean contains(HashSet<Integer> object, int objectId) {
	return object.contains(objectId);
}

    /**
    *Populates the maps
    */
static {
	//All furnace objects
	furnace.add(2781);
	furnace.add(11666);
}

}[/code]

To use:

if(ObjectArrays.contains(ObjectArrays.furnace, id)) { //do something }

So this is for example there is like 12 different ranges in the server you just put them all in the HashSet and check if it has that id in the HashSet. I have always wondered what the best way of handling this would be.

Read full topic
item.source: Checking for a type of a object
